Key Arguments: The legislation demonstrates a lack of trust in the public's ability to discern truth from misinformation.
The government is overstepping by assuming it can be the sole arbiter of truth.
The bill is undemocratic and creates an 'us versus them' mentality.
An informed public capable of critical thinking is preferable to government intervention.
The idea that unelected bureaucrats can determine truth is flawed.
Notable Quotes: The proposed ‘Misinformation Bill’ is a disaster.
The government should trust the Australian public with the responsibility to discern fact from fiction, not take that responsibility away.
No one is able to be the sole source of truth, most definitely not a group of unelected bureaucrats in Canberra.
